charts.market_price2: A chart showing the USD market price from Mt.gox
charts.market_cap2: A graph showing the total number of bitcoins in circulation * the market price in USD.
charts.n_unique_addresses2: A chart of the  number of unique bitcoin addresses used per day.
charts.my_wallet_n_tx: My Wallet Number of Transactions per day
charts.trade_vol2: A chart showing the USD trade volume from the top exchanges.

errors.no_stats: No Stats Found For This Period

charts.n_transactions_excluding_popular2: A chart showing the total number of unique bitcoin transactions per day excluding those which involve any of the top 100 most popular addresses
charts.my_wallet_n_users2: Number of wallets hosts using our My Wallet Service.
charts.days_destroyed_filter_week2: Filtered by minimum input age of 1 week.
charts.my_wallet_transaction_volume2: 24hr Transaction Volume of our web wallet service.
charts.operating_margin2: The graph showing miners revenue minus estimated electricity and bandwidth costs.
charts.mywallet_n_transactions_per_day: My Wallet: Number of transactions per day
charts.transaction_fees2: A charts showing the total BTC value of transaction fees miners earn per day.
charts.hash_rate2: The estimated number of giga hashes per second (billions of hashes per second) the bitcoin network is performing.
charts.days_destroyed_filter_year2: Filtered by minimum input age of 1 year.
charts.title: Bitcoin Charts - Blockchain.info
charts.my_wallet_n_tx2: Number of transactions made by My Wallet Users per day.
charts.n_transactions2: A chart of the total number of unique bitcoin transactions per day.
charts.total_receive_per_day: Total BTC Received per day to:
charts.network_deficit2: Shows difference between transaction fees and cost of bitcoin mining.
charts.blockchain_size2: The total size of all block headers and transactions. Not including database indexes.
charts.days_destroyed_filter_week: Bitcoin Days Destroyed (Filtered By Min Age 1 Week)
charts.n_transactions_per_block2: A chart of the average number of transactions per block.
charts.n_transactions_excluding_popular: Number of transactions excluding popular addresses
charts.days_destroyed2: A none cumulative version of Bitcoin Days Destroyed.
charts.estimated_transaction_volume2: Similar to the total output volume with the addition of an algorithm which attempts to remove change from the total value. This may be a more accurate reflection of the true transaction volume.
charts.days_destroyed_filter_month: Bitcoin Days Destroyed (Filtered By Min Age 1 Month)
charts.cost_per_transaction2: A chart showing miners revenue divided by the number of transactions.
charts.days_destroyed_filter_month2: Filtered by minimum input age of 1 month.
charts.n_unique_addresses: Number Of Unique Bitcoin Addresses Used
charts.avg_confirmation_time2: The Average time take for transactions to be accepted into a block.
charts.mywallet_total_Received_per_day: My Wallet: Total Received per day to:
charts.estimated_transaction_volume_usd2: The Estimated Transaction Volume in USD value.
charts.n_transactions_per_day_to: No. of transactions per day to:
charts.cost_percent_per_transaction2: A chart showing miners revenue as as percentage of the transaction volume.
charts.output_volume2: The total value of all transaction outputs per day. This includes coins which were returned to the sender as change.
charts.total_bitcoins2: A graph showing the historical total number of bitcoins which have been mined.
charts.sub_header: Various bitcoin charts and currency statistics
charts.days_destroyed_filter_year: Bitcoin Days Destroyed (Filtered By Min Age 1 Year)
charts.meta_description: The most popular charts and statistics about the bitcoin network. Number of transactions Per Day, Market Price, Volume charts etc.
charts.miners_revenue2: Historical chart showing number of bitcoins mined per day +  transaction fees * market price.
charts.days_destroyed_cumulative2: Bitcoin Days Destroyed is a measure of the transaction volume of Bitcoin. If someone has 100 BTC that they received a week ago and they spend it then 700 bitcoin days have been destroyed. If they take those 100BTC and send them to several addresses and then spend them then although the total transaction volume could be arbitrarily large the number of bitcoin days destroyed is still 700.
charts.tx_trade_ratio: Trade Volume vs Transaction Volume Ratio
charts.tx_trade_ratio2: Chart showing the relationship between BTC transaction volume and USD exchange volume.

other_links.strange2: Transactions which we were unable to decode the output address
other_links.largest2: Largest 100 transactions from the last 50,000 transactions
other_links.hub_nodes2: A list of the most well connected bitcoin super nodes
other_links.most_popular2: Addresses which have received the most payments
other_links.nodes2: A Log of all bitcoin nodes blockchain.info has connected to
other_links.rejected2: Blocks and transactions which have been rejected by our nodes
other_links.globe2: WebGL globe showing bitcoin nodes (Requires Chrome, Safari)
other_links.double_spends2: Double spends detected in the last 500,000 transactions
other_links.orphaned2: Valid blocks not part of the main bitcoin chain
other_links.pools2: Pie chart showing the market share of the top bitcoin mining pools
other_links.notifications2: Receive free email notifications when there is activity on your bitcoin addresses
other_links.unconfirmed2: Transactions waiting to be included in a block
other_links.wallet2: Manage your money with Bitcoin's most advanced web wallet.

home.sub_header: Most recently mined blocks in the bitcoin block chain
home.search_explain: You may enter a block height, address, block hash, transaction hash, hash160, or ipv4 address..
home.title: Bitcoin Block Explorer - Blockchain.info
home.meta_description: Bitcoin Block Explorer & Currency Statistics. View detailed information on all bitcoin transactions and blocks.

about.p3: For an introduction to bitcoin please see {0}
about.p2: This site allows you to navigate the bitcoin blockchain (a database which holds information about all transactions). We also operate bitcoin's largest and most secure wallet service.
about.p1: Bitcoin is a peer-to-peer currency. Peer-to-peer means that no central authority issues new money or tracks transactions. These tasks are managed collectively by the network.

header.logo_alt_title: Bitcoin block explorer and currency statistics

misc.disclaimer: Any use of the term money on this website refers to virtual currency only. We do not guarantee that bitcoins can be redeemed at the purchase price.

stats.title: Bitcoin Statistics - Blockchain.info
stats.meta_description: Over 100 different bitcoin market and network statistics. Number of nodes, Transaction volume, Mining difficulty and more.
stats.period: All statistics are for the previous 24 hour period unless otherwise stated
stats.notice1: Electricity consumption is estimated based on power consumption of 650 Watts per gigahash and electricity price of 15 cent per kilowatt hour. In reality some miners will be more or less efficient.
stats.notice2: For profit margin hardware costs are estimated to be $1000 per gigahash every 2 years, and bandwidth $1 per gigahash per year.

wallet.new_users_p1: Creating a new bitcoin wallet takes literally a few seconds. You will be able to send and receive payments immediately.
wallet.existing_users_p1: If you have previously created a My Wallet account click below to login.
wallet.help_p1: Please consult the FAQ for commonly asked questions. For any problems with the site please contact us.

transaction_page.title: Bitcoin Transaction {0}
transaction_page.meta_description: View information about a bitcoin transaction {0}
transaction_page.sub_header: View information about a bitcoin transaction

double_spend.p1: Warning! this transaction is a double spend of
double_spend.p2: You should be extremely careful when trusting any transactions to/from this sender.

address.title: Bitcoin Address {0}
address.meta_description: Transactions sent and received from bitcoin address
address.sub_header: Addresses are identifiers which you use to send bitcoins to another person.
address.double_spend_warning: Warning! this bitcoin address contains transactions which may be double spends. You should be extremely careful when trusting any transactions to or from this address.
address.no_transactions: No transactions found for this address, it has probably not been used on the network yet.
address.too_large_to_filter: This Address ledger is too large to filter
address.invalid_address: Sorry this is is not a valid bitcoin address
address.invalid_hash_160: Sorry this is is not a valid  hash 160

wallet_index.title: Bitcoin Wallet
wallet_index.meta_description: My Wallet is a free online bitcoin wallet which you can use to make worldwide payments for free. We make paying with bitcoins easy and secure.
wallet_index.p1: My Wallet is a free online bitcoin wallet which you can use to make worldwide payments for free. We make paying with bitcoins easy and secure available anywhere on your phone or desktop.
wallet_index.p2: We are not a bank, you retain complete ownership of your Money. We cannot view your balance, see your transactions or make payments on your behalf.
wallet_index.techradar_quote: By 2015, cash could be looking like an endangered species

slides.mobile_support_p1: Our web interface supports all popular mobile devices including
slides.mobile_support_p2: If your phone gets lost or stolen your wallet will still be safely backed up on our servers.
slides.double_encryption_p1: Before your bitcoin wallet is saved on our servers it is AES 256 Bit encrypted in your browser. Your password is never shared with us so not even we can open your wallet. Not only that but your wallet can be optionally encrypted again with a second password requiring one password to login and a separate password to make transactions. If that's not enough we also support a variety of two-factor authentication methods including Mt.Gox Yubikeys.
slides.one_click_backups_p1: We make every effort to keep your wallet safely backed up. However there is no substitution for having a backup on your own PC. At a touch of a button you can have your encrypted wallet emailed to you, saved to your dropbox account or saved locally. Then even if blockchain.info suffers data loss or goes offline for you can still access your funds.
slides.payment_notifications_p1: Receive Notifications whenever a payment is sent or received from your bitcoin wallet. The average delay for payment notifications is less that 50ms. If you receive a payment while logged into My Wallet a sound will play and the interface will instantaneously update without needing a page reload.
slides.charts_analytics_p1: Generate charts and reports for recent bitcoin transactions. View your account balance over time, number of transactions and revenue per day.

security.title: Secure
security.p2: encryption to protect your wallet from thieves and hackers. The amazing part is the encryption is all done within your browser, before it is saved on our servers, so not even we have access to your account!
security.p3: My Wallet builds on the security of bitcoin by providing a host of features to help you keep your money safe including

easy.title: Easy To Use
easy.p1: Using My Wallet is no different to using
easy.p2: or online banking. Upon login you will presented with your Balance and a list of your recent transactions
easy.send_via: Send Via Facebook, Email or SMS.

control.title: Retain Control
control.p1: The beauty of bitcoin is that it's fully decentralized, no government or corporation can block payments or revoke accounts.
control.p2: With My Wallet you retain full control of your
control.p4: meaning wallets can never be seized or blocked and can be imported into any desktop bitcoin client.

features.title: Feature Rich
features.p1: The most advanced online bitcoin wallet available.
features.full_list: View a full list of features
features.backups: Ability to make your own backups.

anonymous.title: Anonymous
anonymous.p1: All we require for an account is a password, no other personally identifiable information is needed. We cannot see your public keys, view your transactions or check your account balance.
anonymous.p2: My Wallet also includes a built in

deposit.title: Instant Deposits
deposit.p1: Deposit Bitcoins directly into your My Wallet account in seconds. Via Bank Transfer, Cash Deposit, Barclays PingIt or Phone Billing. Available in the US, UK and 100's of other countries worldwide.

merchants.title: Worldwide Merchants
merchants.p1: 1000's of Merchants already accept bitcoin worldwide with new ones joining everyday. Everything from Online Poker to Organic Coffee you name it you can buy it with bitcoins.
merchants.p2: A full list of bitcoin merchants can be found on the

tooltips.aes: An extremely strong encryption standard adopted by the US government and now widely used worldwide for VPN and other encrypted communications
tooltips.paper_wallet: A paper wallet is a printable document which contains all the information required to recover your bitcoins.
tooltips.remote_backup: Remote backup is when your wallet is stored in separate location other than your local PC. This is important to ensure your money is not lost in the event of a hard drive failure or other computer malfunction
tooltips.offline_transactions: Offline transactions are bitcoin transactions which are generated without an active internet connection. They are considered more secure as your PC is isolated from the internet.
tooltips.paypal: PayPal is an obsolete payment provider
tooltips.private_key: Bitcoin addresses consist of two parts. The private key is the part which is used to prove ownership of an address and is need to withdraw funds. It should be kept safe at all times.

wallet_new.title: My Wallet
wallet_new.sub_header1: Please choose an alias and password for the new wallet.
wallet_new.wallet_created_p1: Your new online wallet has been successfully created. It is important you keep both your wallet identifier and password safe. We are only able to help recover lost wallet identifiers if you provide us with a valid email address. We are unable to help recover lost passwords!
wallet_new.restore_link_title: You may restore this wallet at anytime by visiting:
wallet_new.fav_recommendation: It is recommended you add this to your favourites now.
wallet_new.email_sub: If you would like us to email you a link to you new wallet please enter your email address below.
wallet_new.alias_sub: You can choose a alias for your wallet which you can login with instead of using an identifier.
wallet_new.alias_help_block: A alias or shortlink to help locate the wallet.
wallet_new.dont_forget_password_p1: WARNING: Forgotten passwords are UNRECOVERABLE and will results in LOSS of ALL of your bitcoins!
wallet_new.password_strength_p1: We require a password of at least 10 characters in length to ensure that even if our database is compromised your wallet will remain secure. A password 10 characters in length will take over 1000 years to decrypt.
wallet_new.existing_account: If you already have a My Wallet account {0}
wallet_new.mnemonic_modal_p1: Your wallet has been created successfully. If you forget the password the mnemonic below can be used to recover it.
wallet_new.mnemonic_modal_p2: Without the mnemonic we cannot help recover forgotten passwords and will result in LOSS of ALL of your bitcoins!.

wallet_forgot_identifier.title: Forgot Identifier
wallet_forgot_identifier.sub_header: Enter your email address or sms number below and we'll resend the confirmation link:
wallet_forgot_identifier.p1: If you don't have an email associated with your account please contact us ({0}) with any information you can provide including Skype username, Google Talk username, secret phrase or alias.

balance.title: Your Balance
balance.tip: This shows the balance of your bitcoin wallet. You may not be able to spend this amount until all transactions are confirmed.

connection_status.title: Connection Status
connection_status.tip: If disconnected you will need to refresh the page to see new transactions. When connected new transactions will show instantly.

account_settings.title: Account Settings
account_settings.sub_header: Change your My Wallet account settings.
account_settings.logging_deletion: Altering the logging level does not delete existing logs. Logs expire after 2 weeks.
account_settings.logging_disabled: Logging Disabled. No actions will be logged.
account_settings.logging_level_description: The logging level controls what data is recorded when actions are taken using your wallet. By default the logging is turned off apart from actions taken by admins. Enabling it provides better security by providing more information on potential unauthorized access to your wallet however some privacy may be sacrificed.
account_settings.logging_hashed: Log Actions with Hashed IP Addresses
account_settings.logging_full: Log Actions with IP Address and User Agent
account_settings.email_verification_description: An email is needed to help recover a lost wallet identifier and for payment notifications.
account_settings.alias_description: An alias is short link which can be memorized for quick access to your account without needing to remember an identifier
account_settings.alias_placeholder: A Nickname or other memorable word
account_settings.mobile_number_description: Please enter Your Mobile Phone number below. International SMS messaging can sometimes be unreliable and may not be available to some countries and networks.
account_settings.enter_sms_code: Enter the code contained within verification sms message.
account_settings.automatic_email_backups_description: Check this to receive a new backup automatically when your wallet updates:
account_settings.local_currency_description: You can quickly switch between bitcoins and your local currency by clicking your balance in the top right.
account_settings.inactivity_logout_description: By default you will be automatically be logged out of your wallet account after 10 minutes of inactivity. You can adjust the timeout period below.
account_settings.fee_policy_description: Blockchain.info transactions are free of charge. However the bitcoin network may require an additional Miners Fee which affects the speed your transactions are verified and helps support the network. Change the settings below to alter the default Miners Fee Policy.
account_settings.fee_policy_low_description: A Miners fee will not be included unless absolutely essential.
account_settings.fee_policy_low_warning: Transactions will be significantly slower to confirm
account_settings.fee_policy_normal_description: Follow the fee policy suggested by the mainline bitcoin client.
account_settings.fee_policy_high_description: Fees will be set to ensure transactions are high priority (0.001 BTC Base Fee).
account_settings.integrity_check_description: Checks all keys in your wallet match the correct bitcoin address and re-encrypts your wallet. This may take a long time in some browsers.
account_settings.notifications_description: Optionally receive notifications when a payment is sent or received from your wallet.
account_settings.email_notifications_description: You will receive notifications via email. Please confirm your email address if you haven't already.
account_settings.google_talk_description: You will receive notifications via Google Talk.
account_settings.skype_description: You will receive notifications via Skype to the username below:
account_settings.http_notifications_p1: Http Notifications will be sent when transactions are sent or received. Please see developers section for a guide to implementing the callback.
account_settings.html5_notifications_p1: HTML 5 Notifications are different from regular pop-ups in that they require the user's permission to be shown. Currently supported in Chrome & Safari.
account_settings.device_pairing_description: Scan the code below with your iPhone or Android device to pair it with your account.
account_settings.forgot_password_warning_p2: Any forgotten passwords will result in your wallet being un-accessible. There is no password recovery process!
account_settings.password_notice: Your password is never shared with our servers in any shape or form. This means your wallet would still be safe in the event our servers were compromised. However it means there is no password reset functionality.
account_settings.password_mnemonic_description: Password Mnemonics can be used to recover your wallet password if forgotten. Without the mnemonic there is no way we can help recover a forgotten password. When changing wallet passwords the mnemonic will change.
account_settings.second_password_description: You may optionally set a second password which will be required when you send funds from your account. For large wallets your browser may become unresponsive for a few minutes when changing this option.
account_settings.double_encryption_enabled: Double encryption is enabled. A second password will be required before you can send funds.
account_settings.password_hints_description: If you forget your password(s), hints can be useful to help jog your memory. If there is an email address associated with your account, hints can be emailed to you. If no email is associated with your account, hints are available to anyone who knows your wallet identifier.
account_settings.example_password: If your wallet password was: HorseBatteryStaple a good password hint would be: Electric horse?
account_settings.two_factor_authentication_description: Two factor authentication adds an additional layer of security on top of your password.
account_settings.two_factor_authentication_not_enabled: Two factor authentication is not enabled on your account
account_settings.yubikey_description: To pair your key with your account select the text box below and press the green LED button on your yubikey device.
account_settings.email_description: You will receive authentication codes via email.
account_settings.google_authenticator_description: Open the Google Authenticator app and scan the QR code below to complete the pairing process.
account_settings.google_authenticator_warning: You may be locked out of your account if you leave this page without pairing with the mobile app or disabling Google Authenticator.
account_settings.secret_phrase_description: A secret phrase can be used to help us verify your identity in case of a lost wallet identifier or yubikey. It can be a single word or sentence up to 255 characters in length.
account_settings.always_keep_local_backup_description: Enable this option to force a wallet backup to be stored in your browsers local storage even when two factor authentication is enabled. If enabled an attacker with access to your browser would be able to circumvent two factor authentication, however if the wallet is accessed using any other PC or browser it is still protected by two factor authentication.
account_settings.never_remember_two_factor_description: By Default after logging in with two factor authentication your browser will be remembered for a short period of time allowing you to login again without having to re-authenticate. Check the box below if you want to disable this behaviour and require full authentication every time.
account_settings.my_wallet_verifier_description: If you are concerned about security we highly recommend you install the {0} browser extension. The My Wallet verifier can help protect against server side hacking, malicious javascript and phishing attacks.
account_settings.restrict_to_ip_description: Enable this to restrict access to your wallet to a specific ip address or multiple ip addresses comma separated. Only enable this if you have a static ip address. You will not be able to login or access any API's from any computers not on the specified network however the mobile apps will continue to function once paired.
account_settings.multiple_ip_comma_seperated: Multiple ip addresses should be comma separated.
account_settings.security_warning_sub: Account Settings displays sensitive data which should not be shown to other people. It is recommended you do not open this section in public places or take screenshots of this section.

wallet_home.share_with_anyone: Share this with anyone and they can send you payments.
wallet_home.deposit_description: The quickest and easiest way to deposit bitcoins into your account is to use the services below.
wallet_home.withdraw_description: Use the services below to convert bitcoins back into you local currency.
wallet_home.account_settings_description: Edit your account settings including email address, password and notification settings.
wallet_home.backup_description: Backing up your wallet is an important step which is easy to forget. Blockchain.info takes every precaution to keep your wallet safe but it's always better to keep a local copy just in case.

receive_money.new_address_tooltip: Click here to generate a new bitcoin address. You can begin receiving bitcoins into this address immediately
receive_money.archived_addresses_description: Archived addresses are addresses you may not need anymore that are hidden from the main view but still part of your wallet. You can un-archive them at any time by clicking the blue icon.
receive_money.sweep_keys_tooltip: Move any bitcoins in the selected keys to a different bitcoin address.
receive_money.anonymous_addresses_description: Payments received to anonymous addresses will be forwarded to another address in your wallet. Any payments received are sent through the a mixer isolating your personal wallet from the sender. Transactions received to anonymous addresses cannot be linked to your regular wallet.
receive_money.anonymous_addresses_description2: Anonymous Addresses are valid for one transaction only and incur a 1.5% transaction fee.

login.lost_two_factor: Lost or forgotten two factor authentication details?
login.please_enter_login_details: Please enter your login details below:
login.google_authenticator_help: Please open your Google Authenticator app and enter the code displayed.
login.yubikey_help: Select the text box above and press the green LED light on your Yubikey.
login.email_code_help: An email containing a temporary confirmation code has been sent to your account.
login.sms_code_help: A text message has been sent to your cell phone. Please enter the code in that message above.
login.password_unrecoverable_warning: Your password is never shared with our servers and cannot be recovered if forgotten!
login.resend_link_p1: The email will be sent from wallet@blockchain.info. Be sure to check your spam folder. If you still can't find the email click the button below to resend it.
login.resend_sms_link_title: Did Not Receive An SMS Code?
login.resend_sms_link_p1: Please check your network signal. Messages can take up to 10 minutes to be delivered, if it has been over 10 minutes click the button below to resend the message.
login.forgotten_something_sub: Help! I've locked myself out of my account
login.lost_identifier_p1: If you have lost your wallet identifier first check the confirmation email you received during sign up. Can't find the email? Click the button below and we can send you a new one.
login.lost_two_factor_p1: If you have lost your two factor authentication details your wallet is still fully recoverable. All we need is reasonable proof you are the account owner which can be provided by completing the form linked below.
login.lost_password_p1: Your wallet is encrypted by your browser before it reaches us and for this reason we are unable to help recover lost passwords. To avoid any possible monetary loss due to forgotten passwords it is recommended you make a paper backup of your wallet's private keys.

transactions.no_transactions: Normally your bitcoin transactions would be listed here but you have not made any yet.

send_coins.quick_send_sub: Use the form below to send a payment to a bitcoin address.
send_coins.to_address_tooltip: This is the Bitcoin Address of the recipient.
send_coins.to_address_help: Enter The Bitcoin Address of the Recipient
send_coins.amount_tooltip: The Amount in Bitcoins to Send
send_coins.amount_help: Enter The Amount of Bitcoins to send
send_coins.send_payment_tooltip: Click Here to send payment. You will not be asked to review the transaction.
send_coins.send_via_sms_sub: Use the form below to send bitcoin's via SMS.
send_coins.sms_number_tooltip: Enter the SMS number of the person you want to send bitcoins to.
send_coins.sms_number_help: Enter The SMS Number of the Recipient.
send_coins.send_via_email_sub: Use the form below to send bitcoin's to an email address.
send_coins.email_address_tooltip: This is the email address of the person you wish to send bitcoins to.
send_coins.email_address_help: Enter The Email Address of the Recipient
send_coins.send_anonymously_sub: Use Send Anonymously to guarantee the transaction cannot be traced between sender and receiver.
send_coins.send_anonymously_total: Including fees the total of this transaction is {0}
send_coins.send_anonymously_bonus: The mixer is currently paying a bonus for fresh coins. There will be no fees for this transaction and a bonus of {0} BTC will be paid.
send_coins.send_anonymously_free: The mixer is currently free of charge.
send_coins.review_payment_tooltip: Click Here to review payment. You will be able to confirm or cancel the transaction.
send_coins.anonymous_transaction_fees: All Anonymous transactions incur a {0}% Fee.
send_coins.custom_transaction_sub: Use the form below to send a payment to one or more bitcoin addresses. You will be asked review your transaction before submission.
send_coins.from_address_tooltip: If required you can choose to send coins from a specific address in your wallet.
send_coins.add_recipient_tooltip: If you want to send bitcoins to multiple recipients at once click here to add another address
send_coins.miners_fee_tooltip: This fee will be sent to the bitcoin miners and can help your transaction be processed faster
send_coins.change_address_tooltip: Any Change From The Transaction will be sent back to this address
send_coins.public_note_tooltip: Add a note to this transaction which will be viewable on blockchain.info.
send_coins.public_note_placeholder: This message will be permanently embedded in the blockchain. Anyone can read it.
send_coins.satoshi_dice_sub: {0} is the most popular bitcoin betting game. Win up to 64,000x your bet, instantly. All rolls are verifiable using the blockchain.
send_coins.btcdice_sub: {0} - Choose the odds, place a bet and receive your winnings back in seconds.
send_coins.send_via_facebook_sub: Use the form below to send bitcoin's to a facebook friend.
send_coins.facebook_help: Enter The Name of the facebook recipient
send_coins.address_book_sub: The address book contains a list of sending addresses. You can use it to store the bitcoin addresses of people you know or merchants you use frequently.

import_export.advanced_warning_sub: This section allows you to make changes to your wallet which can be complicated and confusing. It is recommended only experienced Bitcoin Users proceed from here. You should have an understanding of what private keys are and how they relate to bitcoin addresses.
import_export.import_backup_sub: A list of wallet backups available from our cloud storage server.
import_export.watch_only_p1: You may add a {0} bitcoin address to your wallet. You will not be able to send bitcoins from this address without later providing the private key
import_export.import_private_key_p1: Import an existing private key below. All private key formats are supported.
import_export.brain_wallet_p1: A Brain Wallet is a private key seeded from a memorable pass-phrase. It is possible to memorize this password in order to restore the funds at this address without needing a wallet backup.
import_export.brain_wallet_p2: The minimum pass-phrase length is 15 characters. It is highly recommended you still keep regular wallet backups even with the pass-phrase memorized.
import_export.import_paper_p1: Use your Webcam to scan a QR code from a paper wallet
import_export.import_wallet_p1: You may import keys in several different formats.

import_wallet_formats.aes: AES encrypted backup from blockchain.info. (Must be encrypted with the same password)

import_export.import_keys_limit: Please be aware there is currently a limit of 400 private keys per wallet. For large wallets your browser may become unresponsive for a few minutes.
import_export.import_textarea_placeholder: Copy And Paste your wallet data into this area
import_export.export_p1: Below are your private keys AES encrypted.
import_export.export_unencrypted_p1: Below are your private keys in JSON format. Warning! This data is unencrypted keep it safe.
import_export.desktop_sync_p1: This tool enables you to sync your wallet with the official desktop client available from bitcoin.org.
import_export.desktop_sync_instructions: Please install the {0} available for Google Chrome or the {1} available for Mozilla Firefox and Apple Safari (V >= 1.9 required).
import_export.installed_refresh_page: Once installed please refresh this page.
import_export.desktop_sync_step2_p1: In order for your browser to talk to your desktop client your must enable the bitcoin RPC server in the bitcoin.conf file. If the file does not exist you must create it. For Example:
import_export.desktop_sync_change_password: Change username and password to one of your own choice.
import_export.desktop_sync_step2_further_instructions: Once your have modified the file restart the Bitcoin application. For more information on enable the bitcoin RPC interface consult the {0}

rpc.label: Label
rpc.password_help: If your Bitcoin-Qt Wallet is encrypted enter the password here.

modals.second_password_p1: This action requires that you enter your second password which is needed fully decrypt your wallet. You should never enter your second password on an untrusted computer. Use the onscreen keyboard to provide some protection from keyloggers.
modals.main_password_p1: This action requires you re-enter your main password. Please enter it carefully or you may be be logged out.
modals.label_address_p1: Please enter a label for address {0}
modals.label: Label:
modals.label_help: A label is used to help you remember what this address is for. It can be the name of a person or company.
modals.sign_message_sub: Use this tool to sign a message which proves that you own an address. Only Sign Detailed Messages you fully agree with, never sign vague messages. Pressing Sign Message may cause your browser to become unresponsive for a few seconds.
modals.message_placeholder: Enter the Message You Wish To Sign
modals.verify_message_p1: Use this tool verify a message signed by the owner of a particular bitcoin address
modals.verify_result:
This message was signed by address {0}.
Does this match the address you were expecting?
modals.add_address_book_entry_placeholder: Enter the Bitcoin Address you wish to add to your address book.
modals.address_book_label_help: Enter the Label for this address. e.g. the name of the person or company name.
modals.address_not_synced_p1: You are receiving this warning because you have copied an address which has not been yet been synced to the clipboard.
This Address has not been saved on our servers yet and may be lost after leaving this page.
modals.watch_only_warning_p1: You are receiving this warning because you have copied a {0} address to the clipboard.
modals.watch_only_warning_p2: A {0} address means you can only observe the transactions at this address. Unless you have the private key saved elsewhere then you do not own the funds at this address.
modals.watch_only_warning_p3: If you do not have a paper wallet or other backup you should not withdraw coins to this address or instruct anyone to send you coins at this address
modals.add_watch_only_address_p1: Please Confirm you would to add the {0} address {1}.
modals.add_watch_only_address_p3: If you are not clear on the difference between a bitcoin address and a private key then this is probably not the option you want.
modals.confirm_delete_warning: Deleting an incorrect address will cause financial loss. If you are not sure what you are doing press cancel now
modals.confirm_delete_p1: Are you sure would like to remove the address? You will no longer be able to send or receive bitcoins from this address. The balance of this address is:
modals.confirm_delete_countdown: You have {0} seconds to change your mind...
modals.sweep_keys_p1: Sweep means to move all available funds in one or more addresses to another address. Please choose an address where you would like to sweep the selected addresses (Balance {0}).
modals.ask_for_anonymous_p1: Our bitcoin mixer needs your coins. Send this transaction anonymously and get a{0}% bonus ({1} BTC will be sent back to the sending address). The transaction will incur a delay of approximately {2}.
modals.ask_for_anonymous_warning: Do not accept if you expect to receive payment back to the sending address. Anonymous transactions are incompatible with SatoshiDICE, BitLotto and many other bitcoin games.
modals.miners_fee_recommended_p1: This transaction is low priority. It is recommended you include at least a 0.0005 BTC transaction fee in order to ensure miners process it.
modals.miners_fee_recommended_warning: If you do not include a fee this transaction may take a long time to get confirmed. Any funds will be returned to you in approximately 24 hours.
modals.password_change_p1: Your password will be updated immediately. Be sure to make a note of the new password as it cannot be recovered if forgotten! If you have any encrypted wallet backups it will be possible to decrypt them using your old password, it is recommended you remove any of these backups.
modals.created_offline_p1: Your transaction has been created successfully but has not yet been broadcast to the p2p network.
modals.offline_instructions: To complete the transaction open {0}. Copy and paste the text below into the textarea and press submit to complete the transaction.
modals.signing_please_wait: Please Wait. Signing Input Number {0} out of {1}...
modals.please_confirm: Please confirm you would like to {0}
modals.compressed_private_key_p1: Compressed private keys are currently not supported using the Android app, iPhone app or Merchant API. If you import a compressed private key directly you will not be able to spend the funds at that address using the previously listed devices.
modals.compressed_private_key_p2: The recommended solution is to sweep the funds into a existing bitcoin address. Would you like to sweep this private key instead?
modals.send_via_email_sub: The following message will be sent to the recipient.
modals.claim_p1: Please choose one of the options below to claim your bitcoins. Until claimed the sender is able to reverse this payment.
modals.claim_zero_balance: The balance of this bitcoin address is zero. The payment may have already been claimed or the transaction was reversed by the sender.
modals.claim_to_desktop: Enter the bitcoin address of your desktop client:
modals.private_key_needed_p1: This action requires the private key of bitcoin address {0}. Please enter the private key below.

api_index.title: Bitcoin Developer API's - Blockchain.info
api_index.meta_description: Blockchain provides free API's for bitcoin merchants and developers.
api_index.sub_header: Tools for developers to get data about the blockchain
api_index.abuse_notice: Services provided by blockchain.info are free of charge. Please do not abuse them.
api_index.bitpay_description: Blockchain highly recommends Bitpay - The World Leader in Bitcoin Business Solutions. Bitpay offers a complete checkout solution for including automatic conversion to local currencies and integration with a host of shopping cart software.
api_index.welcome_p1: Here you will find everything you need to get started coding for bitcoin. You can use Blockchain.info's own API's or
api_index.receive_payments_description: An incredibly easy method for websites to receive bitcoin payments.
api_index.blockchain_wallet_api_description: API to send and receive payment from a Blockchain Wallet Account
api_index.send_description: Simple JSON api use to programmatically send and receive bitcoins from a My Wallet Account.
api_index.json_rpc_description: Blockchain.info is able to function as a bitcoind RPC server for merchants to interact with their My Wallet Account.
api_index.up_time_description: Blockchain.info use a high availability database cluster and dedicated hardware for maximum up time and low response times.
api_index.data_api_description: Query json data on blocks and transactions. Almost all the data you see on this website is available in JSON format.
api_index.simple_query_api_description: Simple plain text API for querying blockchain data. Compatible with
api_index.websocket_description: Low latency streaming socket channel providing data on new blocks and transactions. Subscribe to notification on blocks, transactions or an address and receive JSON objects describing a transaction or block when an event occurs.
api_index.exchange_rates_data: Currency data from the major bitcoin exchanges.
api_index.charts_and_statistics_description: JSON feed containing the data from the charts and stats pages.
api_index.request_limits_p1: for an API Code to bypass the request limiter please

relayed_by.title: Ips Associated With Address
relayed_by.warning: These IP addresses were the first were the first to relay a transaction involving the selected address. It does not necessarily mean they are the transaction's owner.

about_us.title: About Us - Blockchain.info
about_us.sub_header: Who we are and what we do
about_us.about_p1: Blockchain.info is Bitcoin's most popular bitcoin wallet and block explorer. As of October 2012 the site receives over 10,000 visitors daily and has over 30,000 Users.
about_us.security_p1: Our security policy is to hold as little data as possible that in the event of a security breach could affect our users. Using our My Wallet service we do not hold or intercept any passwords or personally identifying information wallet data is only stored in encrypted form. Blockchain.info runs on privately owned dedicated hardware which can only be accessed by the site administrator. We perform regular security reviews of both our code and servers including scanning our site using nmap to detect possible vulnerabilities early. The site can be access securely using https:// verified by GoDaddy.
about_us.privacy_p1: No Access logs are kept for visits to this website other than simple counters. We do not log any data relating to transactions made through My Wallet or bitcoin addresses used in My Wallet. Any email address, skype name or other personal data provided will not be shared with any other third party or advertisers.
about_us.availability_p1: We aim for 99.5% up time however this service is provided on a best effort basis. If scheduled maintenance is planned we will notify users by email.
about_us.up_time_alt: Up time for blockchain.info: Last 30 days
about_us.response_time_alt: Response time for blockchain.info: Last 30 days
about_us.company_footer: Blockchain.info is owned and operated by Qkos Services Ltd registered United Kingdom company number 05106799
about_us.name: Name:

orphaned_blocks.title: Orphaned Blocks - Blockchain.info
orphaned_blocks.meta_description: Orphaned blocks are valid blocks not part of the main bitcoin block chain.
orphaned_blocks.p1: Detached or Orphaned blocks are valid blocks which are not part of the main chain. They can occur naturally when two miners produce blocks at similar times or they can be caused by an attacker (with enough hashing power) attempting to reverse transactions.

pools.p1: The graph below shows the market share of the most popular bitcoin mining pools. It should only be used as a rough estimate and for various reasons will not be 100% accurate.
pools.warning: A large portion of Unknown blocks does not mean an attack on the network, it simply means we have been unable to determine the origin.

push_tx.p1: This page allows you to paste a raw transaction in hex (i.e. characters 0-9, a-f) this will then be checked it is valid and transmitted over the network.

wallet_backup.p1: Attached to this email is an AES encrypted wallet backup which contains everything you need to restore your bitcoin balance. You can use it to restore the wallet at anytime at {0} or using the 3rd party {1} Desktop client.

translations_page.title: Help Translate Blockchain.info
translations_page.sub_header: Blockchain.info is now available in 16 languages.
translations_page.p1: Blockchain.info is now available in 16 different languages. However the translation has been done primarily by machine, we need your help to provide better translations.
translations_page.p2: If you are familiar with {0} and {1} follow the instructions below:

steps._2: Clone the new fork of the translations project.
steps._3: Download a good JSON editor. We recommend 'Sublime Text 2' available free for Windows, Mac and Linux.
steps._4: Open the files auto_{your_language}.json and {your_language}.json side by side.
steps._5: Any phrases in the auto generated file that do not make sense copy them into the other file and correct the mistakes.
steps._6: The JSON structure must be identical in both files, do not edit any of the key names.
steps._7: When finished commit the changes and submit a {0}.
steps._8: Include your bitcoin address for a bounty or if you prefer change the link on the homepage to your own website.
